reviewText:
If you have played Hatoful Boyfriend and enjoyed it, this is a must for you.  It has every bit of the same wit and charm as the original, and delves yet again into a surreal and tragic nightmare world that you would not initially expect was hiding beneath the veneer of silly, charming birds.  If Bad Boy's Love ruined you before, this will ruin you yet once again.  Be warned:  Once you fly towards the Holiday Star, there is no coming back from the emotional train ride that is waiting for you.

I highly recommend purchasing the Collector's Edition.  You'll receive the sound track, and though most of it is duplicated from the original Hatoful Boyfriend, there are a few new tracks in there.  You'll also receive a high resolution picture library of 36 artwork from within the game, five wallpapers, the rather disturbing Holiday Star dossier, and the King's Storybook, which features a bonus story not included in the game proper.  If you do purchase the Collector's Edition, be sure to play all the way through the game before viewing the bonus content as it may spoil some things.

If you have never played Hatoful Boyfriend, be sure to play the original to its completion prior to playing this game.  You'll need to in order to understand the events here.

reviewText: Once every few years a new tittle is released which shocks the whole gaming industry. This year, we were blessed with Hatoful Boyfriend: Holiday Star. If you played the orginial Hatoful Boyfriend game, this is an absolute MUST. Just like the previous game it was able to capture how beautiful the world would be if it were run by our flying brothers: birds. It's actually rather impressing how someone get sucked into a game like this. This game made me realize I should stop all my studies and just give up, for I will never be as good as the birds in this wonderful datingsim. I have come to realize that I should aim to find myself a beautiful birdhusbando who will take care of me. This game will absolutely change your life and it will make you realize how weak we are as a race and how we should invest all our capitalist scum moneyz to create a school as wonderful as St. Pigeonations for birds and exclusively for birds.\nThis game will deliver you some amazingly phasant times! It's perfect for the holidays, as long as you don't mind the psychological scarring! Though you might find it hard to eat poultry ever again after finishing this masterpiece. 14/10.

reviewText: What was charming about the first game is no longer a factor. This felt more like a visual novel than an actual dating sim. But you know I don‚Äôt think I would care since the premise of the previous game made it seemed like it was the last thing that mattered. However for whatever reason by removing that element, they also killed off the branching factors of story outcomes. The only options you are given is the correct command or a game over. Meaning everything is already set in stone. So my interest is pretty much gone after a few chapters have been completed. Even if you played the first game. I don‚Äôt think I could recommend this honestly... It does pain me to say that though, because I loved the first one so much, lol.

reviewText:
Please read the first Hatoful Boyfriend beforehand. If not, you won‚Äôt quite understand everything, and the story will be much less impactful.I'm not sure what I was expecting coming into this. Hatoful Boyfriend had me pleasantly surprised with its profound and compelling storyline (my review). I wondered if the Christmas edition would offer something similar, or if it would be short and cheery for the holiday season. I was not disappointed when I was given a sweet story with the perfect amount of humour and darkness to keep it interesting.

Hatoful Boyfriend: Holiday Star is divided into 4 chapters, and includes 6 short episodes and 6 radio episodes.Everything is well divided into bits, so you can have short, sweet doses of your favourite bird hubbies.

The Main StoryThe main story is straightforward and linear, rather than being a dating sim with multiple endings.
I won‚Äôt reveal much, to avoid spoiling the plot, but I honestly do recommend this sequel. Beyond the charming hilarity of every character being a bird is a genuinely enjoyable visual novel. Had the characters not been birds, I would still recommend it, purely based on the story. It‚Äôs nothing groundbreaking, but it is worth praising.
Hatoful Boyfriend: Holiday Star will give you everything you could ever want for the holidays; romance, sacrifice, mystery, and murder. It explores the weaknesses of everybirdies‚Äô hearts, and is amusingly self aware with its humour, poking fun at itself on multiple occasions.
If you loved the first one, don‚Äôt hesitate to buy this one. It has some mysterious notes, leaving you wanting more, but it doesn‚Äôt feel as if it‚Äôs lacking. If anything, it sets itself up for another Hatoful Boyfriend VN (HEAR THAT? WE WANT MORE).

Short Episodes and RadioIn the short episodes, you get to go on dates with your birdy boys. Choose to view their bird models, or their humans models, and enjoy! Each of the dates are short and sweet.
The radio episodes are filled with humour, and will answer important questions for the viewers (what is everybirdies' underwear colour?????)

The badI have plenty of praise, but if I have to state some negatives, here they are:
The editing could use a little more care, as I picked up on a couple grammar/spelling errors. It‚Äôs nothing serious, but it‚Äôs worth noting.
It‚Äôs easy to get confused sometimes, considering the different routes and timelines that everything takes place in.
All in all, it‚Äôs good fun. Pick it up and enjoy your handsome bird boys. Make an excessive amount of bird puns when friends message you to question what you‚Äôre playing, and then force them to play it too.
It‚Äôs a coo‚Äô game.

sorry

reviewText:
Holiday Star  is the not-quite-a-sequel, not-quite-a-prequel to  Hatoful Boyfriend,  the infamous ‚Äúpigeon dating simulator‚Äù that turned out to be so much more than just a lulz-y joke.  It takes place in an alternate timeline from the previous game (ignoring the events of what  Hatoful  players call ‚Äúthe BBL route‚Äù), and assumes that the player already has some basic familiarity with the characters.

Most notably from a gameplay perspective,  Holiday Star  abandons the dating-sim structure of  Hatoful Boyfriend  in favor of a straightforward visual-novel approach.  The player is given a few choices to make over the course of the game, but most of these either advance the plot or result in insta-death, rendering the choices essentially false.  In other words, it‚Äôs basically what fans of the genre call a ‚Äúkinetic‚Äù (i.e. choice-less) story.  This is a game for people who love the characters of  Hatoful Boyfriend  and just want to tag along with them on some silly holiday-themed adventures, rather than control the story from the driver‚Äôs seat.

I use the word ‚Äúsilly‚Äù deliberately.  Although there are a few genuinely touching moments (a conversation between Ryouta and Yuuya about love and the possibility of rejection comes to mind), most of the game is taken up with deliberately absurd, even surreal humor.  For example, in one chapter the nefarious villain (a flamboyant scientist with a score to settle) tries to destroy St. PigeoNation‚Äôs Academy by blasting it with a cannon powered by female manga nerds. (I have heard that the fantasies of fangirls surpass those of any fanboy. Observe
date: and be destroyed!").  There‚Äôs also plenty of fourth wall-breaking moments
recommended: including radio interludes where the characters respond to questions from real-life fans of the series about their taste in underwear

votesHelpful: but it‚Äôs still an endearing and sometimes hilarious experience

reviewText:
Two things:

1. This game relies heavily on the character development from the first Hatoful Boyfriend so you need to play that one to understand this one.
2. This game consists of small episodes instead of a large branching story.  In fact this game really has no branching paths at all; the few times you have to make a choice either lets the story progress or gives you a game over.

This game is good if you want to see your favorite birds from the first game get more screen time.  Just know that this is not nearly as involved as the first game was.

Also, it is not as Christmas-y as I was expecting.  Only one episode is Christmas themed. It also has some New Years focus and general winter time feel. In case that matters to you.
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Unlike the first Hatoful Boyfriend release, which is an otome game, this is more of a Visual Novel style, and much shorter than the first title as well. A bit more linear than the first, but still a great game overall. I'll try to review this without spoiling anything.

Pros: Your favourite pigeons (And Hiyoko) return with more vibrant personalities than before! Especially the good doctor... Ho ho ho.[puu.sh]
The dialogue is just as great as the first title! Still witty and charming!
Instead of starting a new game and playing the same scenes over and over in the first title for another route, this is more straightforward, since the stories in this game are separated by 'chapters'.
Like the first title, this game has a good story!
There's alternate scenes to see the pigeons as humans (!!!)Cons: The portrait quality isn't as good as the first, there's traces of jpg on the portrait's outlines, most noticibly Ryouta (Minor problem)
Requires you to play through the first title to know what's going on, or you might be lost.
Didn't hit you like a truck as much like the first game did. Don't worry if you don't know what I mean by this. You'll know what I mean if you played the end of the first game.Overall, if you are a fan of the first title, you will enjoy the second title! If you are new to the series, please play the first title before getting this one! I assure you, dating pigeons are quite... satisfying and fun. Yep...~

Trivia: The creator of the game, Moa, likes Undertale and sharing her playthrough with the Japanese community with subtitles! Give it a look, if you want!

The fanservice is really appreciated, thank you for having this on Steam for us!!!

reviewText:
First of all, play the first game before this one. Just do it. I've played the original Holiday Star so I know this game is amazing and I would absolutely recommend it. Even though Holiday Star is based off story and not much options or routes, it doesn't make it any less of a game and makes up for it with incredible backstories and settings.

For the steam version in particular, the new art is beautiful and really stands out, but a couple of people have pointed out the music. There were loads of really nice royalty-free music tracks (I believe by Sentive and TAM) in the original game which for some reason aren't in this version. I was really hoping a particular track (end of chapter 2) would be there but when it wasn't I was kinda sad, and I'm worried that some really emotional songs later on in the game in heart-wrenching moments are just going to be replaced by awkward silence. Music really adds a lot to a game, even if it's just pigeons talking in a dialogue box, so when there's nothing there it just makes the game feel a lot emptier. I'm not sure if this is intentional or not, but I hope Moa can see these reviews and maybe try to get the same music back on becuase some of those tracks fit so beautifully to the game.

Besides that, I love this game so much and the steam rework got me hyped to replay it! 10/10 would get pigeon feels all over again

reviewText:
This game functions more as a standalone expansion to the original than a full sequel, but that's not necesarily a bad thing.
It does the smart thing and uses all the world building and character development from the first game as a base and creates some new scenerios with that established world (and that includes the BBL ending, it's not COMPLETELY spoiled by the events of this game, but it is referenced, it's reccomended you get the full ending in the original before playing this one, things'll make alot more sence).
It was originally released episodically as four seperate mini-stories with one overaching continuity between them and you can tell, if I have one major criticism it's that they've stripped out alot of the interactivity from the first game and seemed to have ditched the bird dating sim" gag for a more straightforward visual novel set in the same universe.
But if you liked the original game then you are definitely going to like this
date: as it's pretty much just more of it. More bizarre scenerios
hoursPlayed:
and more jarring juxtaposition between a lighthearted surface level and a pitch dark undertone.
Enjoy it for what it is!

Also it's implied to be set in a universe where you're going down my personal favorite non-Shuu path and that makes me feel vindicated"

reviewText:
So I unlike a lot of reviewers here aren't bothered at all but the shift in gameplay from Otome to pure Visual Novel.  I feel like after establishing the characters and dynamics among the cast, they game is right to focus on telling interesting stories with them. And the stories in this game are all indeed fun, heartwarming, and sometimes tragic, just like in the original Hatoful Boyfriend.

However I take issue with the Steam release of this game specifically. See the first game's Steam release had all the content from the original game and more alongside the prettier backgrounds.  This game doesn't add anything as far as I've seen so far, but that doesn't honestly bother me the increase in visuals is very noticable in some areas.  What DOES bother me is the fact that they've hacked this games soundtrack to bits.   Like 40% of scenes don't have any music in them, not for atmosphere but due to the fact that for whatever reason the Steam release lost a good chunk of the songs that filled the original version of Holiday Star.  The loss of these songs makes the game feel a lot emptier especially in moments where the music added a lot to the tone of the scene.  I hope this is a technical error of some kind because if they couldn't use some of the (royalty free) music from the original release then they should have replaced those songs with songs they still had permission to use.

So I can say this is still a good game full of interesting and hilarious stories, but it's really dissapointing that they were so lazy with this port in terms of the music.  I would reccomend the original version of Holiday Star, but that is tied to Famous Writer, which I beleive is no longer functional on fully updated Windows 10 computers, and must be patched for it to be understandable in English.

reviewText: The HD ports are getting a little sloppy- this game had typos, missing music, missing CGs, missing or misalighned sprites and a few innapropriately resued HD BGs from the first game. The HD port is novel and overdue but I'm afraid first time players will find the experience lacking due to these clumsy mistakes. Please dont let these (admittedly minor) problems turn you off from the game. The story is just as silly, charming and emotionally destructive as the original! Hato Moa never disapoints, and dont let a few mistakes on behalf of the developer reflect badly on her work! That said the new, snowy BGs are lovely and an improvement over the original, they really set the tone! I was hoping for some additional content, but there's plenty here to do, definitely worth your $10.\n\n(Protip: dont play any of the bonus episodes until you've finished the main story!)

reviewText:
MERRY CHRISTMAS! ( MERRY CHRISTMAS! )

This game has charming story at first, then later it gets quite depressing for a christmas tale... The storie may not be deep as the first one, still  its very enjoyable with their odd elements.

reviewText:
Hatoful Boyfriend es el simulador de citas con palomas por excelencia, o mas bien el √∫nico. Tuvo tanta repercusi√≥n y √©xito por all√° en el 2011 que los desarrolladores decidieron realizar una nueva versi√≥n para las fiestas. No se trata de un DLC ni nada por el estilo, sino mas bien un juego aparte y en plena epoca navide√±a paso a coment√°rtelo.


El juego se divide en cuatro episodios y una serie de cap√≠tulos extra mas cortos, adem√°s de otros extras que simulan ser un programa radial conducido por las mismas palomas y est√°n referidos a la historia del juego.

Al comienzo de cada episodio tenemos la posibilidad de elegir nuestro nombre y apellido, que es el que utilizar√°n el resto de los personajes para referirse a nosotros. Podemos tener diferentes nombres en cada uno de los cap√≠tulos ya que no afecta la experiencia de juego.

Sin spoilearte nada te cuento que le primer episodio se centra en las festividades navide√±as y nosotros, unos simples humanos, junto con otras palomas, tenemos que descubrir qui√©nes son los ladrones de la Navidad que se est√°n robando los √°rboles del vecindario y del instituto al cual aparentemente concurrimos. El segundo se aleja un poco del esp√≠ritu navide√±o y nos sit√∫a en una convenci√≥n de manga y anim√© en la cual tenemos que evitar que nuestro amigo paloma se involucre en la edici√≥n de su manga con un villano que planea destruir todo con su rayo laser *inserte gif de Monsters Inc.*. El tercer y cuarto episodio est√°n enlazados y transcurren en un sue√±o que todas las palomas tienen en conjunto.


Si a√∫n no te diste cuenta lo bizarro que es desde el t√≠tulo, tambi√©n hay tanques de guerra, rayos laser como mencion√© anteriormente y algunos otros artefactos propios de un villano de pel√≠cula como para darle vida a la historia, la cual no es tan divertida como parece.

Siendo un ‚Äújuego‚Äù estilo visual novel no est√° muy bien realizado ya que en cada uno de los cap√≠tulos tenemos solo una oportunidad en la cual elegir una opci√≥n que cambie el resto de la historia, por lo tanto se torna aburrido y pesado esperar hasta ese momento para ver si nuestra opci√≥n es la adecuada o no.


Otro factor que juega en contra es la calidad visual de los p√°jaros. Se ven pixelados, y si bien no es un juego en donde los gr√°ficos tengan que ser excepcionales, molesta estar jugando con tu personaje en una calidad m√°s baja que la escena de fondo.

A todo esto, si le vemos el lado positivo podemos rescatar la personalidad de las aves. No solo hay palomas, sino tambi√©n hay otro tipo de p√°jaros similares y no tanto, que se diferencian por sus plumajes. Son personajes bastante estereotipados pero al ser animales, resulta mucho mas divertido que en cualquier otro contexto.


La m√∫sica es algo que sobresale, no solo porque muchas veces no concuerda con la situaci√≥n y en este caso sobresale literalmente, sino que es muy buena. Como es una versi√≥n navide√±a, muchas de las canciones est√°n relacionadas con √©sta tem√°tica, como por ejemplo los t√≠picos villancicos o El cascanueces; pero por otro lado puede pasar a tener temas al mejor estilo instrumental de Metallica o Linkin Park que nada se relacionan con las escenas pero es una de las cosas mas disfrutables.

Muchas veces se torna inc√≥modo jugar a ser un humano en d√≥nde una paloma te est√° tirando palos y te gusta, y lo peor es cuando no sab√©s ni siquiera el g√©nero de la paloma con la que est√°s hablando porque las se√±ales son muy pocas, incluso los nombres japoneses son dif√≠ciles de predecir.

No es un juego que recomiende incluso si sos muy fan de las visual novels. Las historias no son divertidas, los chistes no logran hacer reir, es muy corta y graficamente no es un buen producto. No le pidas Hatoful Boyfriend: Holiday Star a Pap√° Noel, es mejor el carb√≥n.

reviewText: I'm pretty sure no one expected Hatoful Boyfriend to be as good as it is (me included), but given what the original Hatoful Boyfriend did; how could one expect the sequel to end up?\n\nUnfortunately, not much. Since the previous game had wrapped up just about everybirdie's character arc, there wasn't much room for expansion in the characters. Holiday Star abandons the pigeon dating simulator" thing for a more linear story. That's not to say it's bad
date: in fact it reduces the redundant dialogue from replaying the game. But with the branching story gone
recommended: it's hard not to feel something was taken.\n\nSadly
hoursPlayed: if you've already played the previous game Holiday Star doesn't give you that morbid curiousity that makes you say "this is a weird dating sim"; since the previous game perfectly elaborated the backstory. And without that sense of curiousity
voteText: Holiday Star just isn't as mind-blowing as the first game.\n\nWhile Holiday Star's writing isn't as good as the previous game's
helpfulPercent: it does make it up with the story. Since Holiday Star has almost no pretenses of being a "pigeon dating simulator"
votesHelpful: the story focuses less on the character and instead on your bizarre adventures in St. Pigeonations. What Holiday Star has a hard time doing compared to the previous game is to subvert expectations
votesTotal: since the first game blew it's load on that department; there wasn't much Holiday Star could do in that regard.\n\nAlso
votesFunny: Holiday Star has the nasty habit of giving you a choice that actually could give you a bad ending and makes you restart the game. This would be fine if Holiday Star was closer to a dating sim
commentsCount: but given the linearity of the game it's easy to forget to save and end up repeating an entire episode. My best advice here is to save if a choice pops up.\n\nHoliday Star is accessible without playing the previous game
column16: but it's still highly recommended that you play the previous game first; just so you'd already be emotionally invested in the characters.\n\nHoliday Star perfectly supplements the previous game's story
column17: but unfortunately that's as much as I can say about it. Think of Holiday Star as a doujin/fanfic that adds the story of the previous game
column18: but without the joy of it being as new as the original."

reviewText:
How should I review this game? It's ... many things. First piece of advice though: you should play the original else you'll have absolutely no context for what the hell is going on at any given point.

Basically? It's a dating sim with pigeons and doves instead of humans. but Holiday Star is specifically Christmas / New Year themed. There is a branching storyline seen from different points of view (similar to the original game) but it diverts from its starting point by a pretty huge margin.

Hatoful is never really what you'd expect. For a game that started off as a joke idea, it does hold quite a bit of emotion in its dialogue and the characterisation is really quite good. Surprisingly, there are little trivia bits of Japanese culture to be found too.

And I think Yuuya is the birdie for me!

reviewText:
Initially, you'll buy this game as a joke. You're a human girl who is in love with pigeons -- but that's not the story.

Hatoful Boyfriend somehow pulls off being your typical cute visual novel dating sim, while simultaneously shoving in a bizarro sci-fi plot that can sometimes be a little unsettling to play at night.

10/10 would have all the crushes on pigeons again.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: Holiday Star isn't a sequel to Hatoful Boyfriend, nor is it a dating sim. It's firmly a visual novel, pretty much without branching paths and has a couple bad ends you need to be aware of. For some reason, I didn't have an option to save my game, so that made things inconvenient. But as far as the story goes -- I love it; I find it much more moving than the original Hatoful Boyfriend. The first two episodes are adorable and hilarious, and the second two are mostly serious. Very tragic, and very well written. If you're sensitive to the topics of suicide, note that one character has depression and talks about suicide.\n\nI am all about Nageki, so I was all about this game.

10/10

Nonetheless... Ho Ho Ho.

reviewText: We recieved yet another edition of our favorite cast of burbs from Devolver Digital. While this version is structured differently from the first, you will gain nothing less from the story divisions. There are still plenty of feels, twists, and turns to be had. Otome games are a large chunk of my spending on mobile and Steam games and I feel like Hatoful Boyfriend as a franchise has a lot of promise and shine to it that not a lot of other titles out there have-- Holiday Star takes that charm and multiplies it..you will never catch this property going off in one direction of taking itself too seriously or being a 100% joke. There are multiple branches of depth and plot to these characters as they inhabit their own birdy world and bring you into it--you are not merely a statue in the background. World the price for the deluxe edition and I hope we get more products from this series.

reviewText: A fun exploration of side stories in the Hatoful World. It takes place before the Extended Ending of the first game, and lets you go on fun adventures with the characters you loved. I wish this game had come out on steam sooner so my connection with the characters was still fresh, but it was a great reminder of why I loved the first one. Not without its share of feels or new story additions in surprising places, and a fun addition to the Hatoful World.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I absolutely admired Hatoful Boyfriend. I played it on a friends computer (she received it as a joke) and I would not leave her room until I got to the BBL Route.
The whole time you played you could feel something deeper, darker webbing everybirdie together (My first immediate hint was your main character is sleeping in a cave while everybirdie else has a house.) and sure enough, there it was. One of the most inventive and interesting stories I played all year. Disguised as a supposedly ridiculous bird dating sim.
Now let's talk about this one.
I immediately bought it without thinking. This one branches out from the last one in a sort of alternate continuation. Once again I was just absorbed and waiting for something terrible to happen.
I just feel these are brilliantly written and I was so happy to play more.
Of course it isn't for everyone. If you don't enjoy reading, or dating sims....or birds....or the first game....then you probably won't like this one. It's one of those types of games you either hate or love, and I'm all for something different and interesting with great character development.  Great Job Mediatonic!  I'm totally open to more of these, they are just too fun!

reviewText: Hatoful Boyfriend at first seems like a little bit of senseless fun, and of course at first it is. If you come into it looking for more you will be dissapointed, but if you are not you may find yourself a pleasant* surprise.\n\nJust like in the first game, Hatoful Boyfriend: Holiday Star" starts off a little slow and is a silly game just for messing around and enjoying yourself. The story however progresses in the fourth chapter
date: where the tone changes drastically from senseless fun to a more serious story. You tend to forget that the characters here are birds
recommended: and if you have played the last game you can make some very interesting connections.\n\nI would reccomend playing the first game first
hoursPlayed: but keep in mind that until the BBL route in the first game and the fourth chapter in Holiday Star
voteText: you may need some patience to get to the good stuff.\n\nI personally found the first part a little boring
helpfulPercent: and even started to wonder if it had all been worth my time. The lack of options reminded me of the BBL route minus the tension and atmosphere so I was a little unhappy
votesHelpful: but I kept going and managed to discover that the way that these games work is consistant. It gets good at the end. Sure
votesTotal: it is also largely up to personal taste if you like the sort of story it presents when it "gets good" but for me it was certainly worth the patience.\n\nIf an upgrade to "Dove
votesFunny: Actually" becomes possible from having the normal edition
commentsCount:
I'll be putting it on my wishlist.

TIP: During chapter 4 save your game when you remember! Wrong choices end in an instant game over and if you haven't saved you have to start the chapter again. I failed at every option the first time each of them showed up and It was really annoying.

*by pleasant I mean it hurts but it's good."

reviewText:
Game is sort of like the first one, except there is a lot of reading and a lot less interaction. Basically if you choose the wrong  answer it's game over (so save). It's a slightly different format as well.

Regardless, I love my bird boyfriends, I finished it 100%, and I cry ever tim.

11/10 would date birds again

reviewText:
This game was cute and fun to play through, just like the first Hatoful Boyfriend.

That being said, the similarities don't go much beyond that. The format is slightly changed and the game is much more story-heavy; If you liked the openess and choice based gameplay of the first game this may not be the game for you.

Overall though 10/10 I loved the story and seeing my old favorite birds come to life in new ways again, also the achievements are fairly easy.

reviewText: Much less of a dating sim than the previous game, but still incredibly good. Holiday star reveals more about characters and introduces new ones, therefore making it a really fun experience for people who liked Hatoful Boyfriend. Well... it also manages to slap you into face with your own heart a couple of times, but that's also nothing new when it comes to Hatoful Boyfriend games.\nI absolutely love backgrounds and human design sprites in this game. I could've stared at them all day, honestly. The music was also really good and well chosen.\nI loved the first Hatoful Boyfriend and i love its sequel just as much. Definitely get this one too if you liked the first one!

reviewText: While not as essential as the first delicious installment, this sequel to Hatoful Boyfriend is worth your time if you enjoyed the original. The timeline follows the students of St. Pigeonation's as they experience an adventure with new villains and journey to the Holiday Star, a place ruled by the King of Dreaming.\n\nApparently the story is an offshoot of the true" ending of the original game and takes place as if the events of that ending never happened. All of your favorite characters are here
recommended: and even some new ones!\n\nSo you might say this is not so much a sequel as it is some really elaborate DLC for Hatoful Boyfriend. I can't recommend it to anyone who hasn't played through the first game... and then only if you really liked it!"
voteText: true
